title: Support (mathematics)
summary: In mathematics, the support of a real-valued function f {\displaystyle f} is the subset of the function domain containing the elements which are not mapped to zero. If the domain of f {\displaystyle f} is a topological space, then the support of f {\displaystyle f} is instead defined as the smallest closed set containing all points not mapped to zero. This concept is used very widely in mathematical analysis.
